author: Asjylyn Loder
title: The Man Who Walked Away From $40 Billion ETF Post Launches His Own Investment Models - MoneyBeat - WSJ
text: Jon Maier used to be the man who picked the exchange-traded funds that went into $40 billion of prepackaged investment portfolios sold by Merrill Lynch. He became so well-known in the industry that the strategies earned the nickname “the Maier models.” Now he’s trying to parlay his name into a new empire. Mr. Maier left The Long Road
